model
Class ScoreCard

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      model.ScoreCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Score>
public class ScoreCard
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Iterable<Score>

A Score Card keeps score for a certain player. The ScoreCard object implements the Iterator design pattern.

Version:
1.5.0 2011
Author:
Aaron Lamb

Constructor Detail

ScoreCard

public ScoreCard()
Constructs a new ScoreCard object

Method Detail

setScore

public boolean setScore(Hands hand,
                        int score)
Sets the score corresponding to the given hand to the given score If the score is already taken this will return false and do nothing

Parameters:
hand - the hand for which to record the score
score - the score to record for the corresponding hand
Returns:
true if the score is recorded, false if it cannot be

getScore

public Score getScore(Hands hand)
Returns the Score object for the corresponding hand

Parameters:
hand - the hand for which to retrieve the Score
Returns:
the Score object corresponding to the passed hand

getUpperTotal

public int getUpperTotal()
Returns the total of the upper six elements on the ScoreCard: Ones, Twos, Threes, Fours, Fives, Sixes. This does NOT add the upper bonus if it is applicable. Call getUpperBonus() for that.

Returns:
the score for the first six categories on a Yahtzee score card

getLowerTotal

public int getLowerTotal()
Returns the total of the lower seven elements on the ScoreCard: Three of a Kind, Four of a Kind, Full House, Small Straight, Large Straight, Yahtzee, Chance. This does NOT add any Yahtzee bonus that may be applicable. Call getYahtzeeBonus() for that.

Returns:
the score for the last seven categories on a Yahtzee score card

getUpperBonus

public int getUpperBonus()
Returns the Upper Bonus value: 35 if the bonus can be taken (if the upper total is >= 63) or 0 if it cannot be taken.

Returns:
the upper bonus value

getYahtzeeBonus

public int getYahtzeeBonus()
Returns the Yahtzee Bonus value: +100 points for every additional Yahtzee rolled after the first Yahtzee has been scored.

Returns:
the yahtzee bonus value

yahtzee

public boolean yahtzee()
Returns whether or not a Yahtzee has been scored

Returns:
true if a Yahtzee has been scored, false if not

takeYahtzeeBonus

public void takeYahtzeeBonus()
Takes the Yahtzee bonus by incrementing the value of the Yahtzee bonus by 100 if the count != yahtzeeBonusTurnNumber. Generally, the yahtzee bonus cannot be taken more than once each turn: if this turn is the same as when the last bonus was taken then the bonus will NOT be taken. Therefore, you may call the Yahtzee bonus everytime a Yahtzee is rolled and yahtzee() is true.

isFull

public boolean isFull()
Checks whether the ScoreCard is full

Returns:
true if the ScoreCard is full, false otherwise

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of the ScoreCard

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

iterator

public java.util.Iterator<Score> iterator()
Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Score>
